title: Development of six tumors in a sebaceus nevus of jadassohn: report of a case.
label: Fig. 1
caption: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum in the superficial part of the lesion. Tubular apocrine adenoma and cystic dilate glands in the deeper part.

title: Development of six tumors in a sebaceus nevus of jadassohn: report of a case.
label: Fig. 2
caption: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum in the superficial part of the lesion. (A) Pigmented trichoblastoma and cystic dilate glands in the deeper part. (B) Pigmented trichoblastoma in the deeper part. (C) Typical features of syringocystadenoma papilliferum. (D) Pigmented trichoblastoma; lobules of basaloid aggregates with peripheral palisading.

title: Development of six tumors in a sebaceus nevus of jadassohn: report of a case.
label: Fig. 3
caption: Tumor of follicular infundibulum. Aggregates of small keratinocytes show multiple connections to the epidermis and form a superficial dermal plaque.

title: Development of six tumors in a sebaceus nevus of jadassohn: report of a case.
label: Fig. 4
caption: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum in the superficial part, pigmented trichoblastoma and sebaceoma in the deeper part.

title: Development of six tumors in a sebaceus nevus of jadassohn: report of a case.
label: Fig. 5
caption: (A) Superficial epithelioma with sebaceus differentiation above the trichoblastoma. (B) Superficial epithelioma with sebaceous differentiation. (C) Sebaceous differentiation in the superficial epithelioma.

title: Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 1
caption: Hairless scalp vertex lesion present since birth that has been slowly enlarging.

title: Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 2
caption: Enlarged view of scalp vertex lesion with a smooth, tan, plaque-like appearance.

title: Basal Cell Carcinoma and Syringocystadenoma Papilliferum Arising in Nevus Sebaceous on Face-A Rare Entity.
label: Figure 1
caption: (a) Lesion of nevus sebaceous of Jadassohn on the left side of the face. (b) Scar of the lesion after 10 days of complete excision

title: Basal Cell Carcinoma and Syringocystadenoma Papilliferum Arising in Nevus Sebaceous on Face-A Rare Entity.
label: Figure 2
caption: (a) H and E stain scanner view ×4 showing nevus sebaceous and syringocystadenoma papilliferum. (b) H and E stain scanner ×4 view showing basal cell carcinoma and Syringocystadenoma papilliferum. (c) H and E stain, low power ×10 view showing dermis having mature sebaceous glands and a hair follicle

title: Basal Cell Carcinoma and Syringocystadenoma Papilliferum Arising in Nevus Sebaceous on Face-A Rare Entity.
label: Figure 3
caption: (a) H and E Stain High power ×40 view showing cluster of basaloid cells with peripheral pallisading of lesional cell nuclei and clefting artifact between the epithelium and stroma. (b) H and E stain, low power ×10 view showing dermal cysts with numerous papillary projections lined by two layers of a luminal columnar epithelium with evidence of decapitation secretion and outer flattened cuboidal epithelium

title: Dermoscopy of collision tumor arising in nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Fig 1
caption: NSJ surmounted in the superior portion by a firm nodule. NSJ, Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.

title: Dermoscopy of collision tumor arising in nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Fig 2
caption: Dermoscopy of collision tumor: purple ovoid nests (black asterisk) separated by white septa (black arrows), surmounted by arborescent telangiectasias (white arrows), and surrounded by yellowish ovoid structures (white asterisk) along with yellow-pink area (white ovoid shapes) and crusts (black triangles).

title: Dermoscopy of collision tumor arising in nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Fig 3
caption: Dermoscopy of NSJ: Yellowish globules (white arrows) aggregated in clusters on a yellow background (black asterisk). NSJ, Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.

title: Dermoscopy of collision tumor arising in nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Fig 4
caption: A, Histological image of sebaceoma and SCAP. B, Multiple tumor lobules, not connected to the epidermis. The tumor is composed mainly of immature and monomorphic sebocytes, suggesting sebaceoma. C, Invaginations with papillary projections, the mucosa of which was made up by a double layer of cuboid cells, suggesting a SCAP (Hematoxylin-eosin–stain ×20). SCAP, Syringocystadenoma papilliferum.

title: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn - high frequency ultrasound imaging and videodermoscopy examination. Case presentation.
label: Figure 1
caption: Patient’s clinical photo.

title: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn - high frequency ultrasound imaging and videodermoscopy examination. Case presentation.
label: Figure 2
caption: Videodermoscopy of the nevus plaque, a - in non-polarized light, b - in polarized light.

title: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn - high frequency ultrasound imaging and videodermoscopy examination. Case presentation.
label: Figure 3
caption: Videodermoscopy of follicle opening, blocked with the sebum secretion, a - in non-polarized light, b - in polarized light.

title: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn - high frequency ultrasound imaging and videodermoscopy examination. Case presentation.
label: Figure 4
caption: 33 MHz scan at ROI (a) and 33 MHz scan of the intact skin, (b) in the contralateral area. f - foil on the probe tip, g - contact gel, e - epidermis, d - dermis, fat - fat tissue, fas - superficial fascia.

title: Nevus sebaceus of Jadassohn - high frequency ultrasound imaging and videodermoscopy examination. Case presentation.
label: Figure 5
caption: 50 MHz scan at ROI (a) and 50 MHz scan of the intact skin, (b) in the contralateral area. f - foil on the probe tip, g - contact gel, e - epidermis, d - dermis, fat - fat tissue, hf - hair follicle, sg - sebum gland conglomerate, c - cystic dilated glands ducts.

title: A Rare Case of Porocarcinoma and Trichoblastoma Arising in a Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 1
caption: Clinical appearance of left parietal lesion at presentation to dermatology clinic.

title: A Rare Case of Porocarcinoma and Trichoblastoma Arising in a Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 2
caption: (a) Scanning micrograph of the porocarcinoma shows an expansile tumor arising from the epidermis with extension deep into the reticular dermis (hematoxylin and eosin, 4x). (b) Higher power shows focal necrosis of the tumor which displays cytologic atypia, including mitotic figures (hematoxylin and eosin, 20x).

title: Trichoblastoma Arising From the Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 1
caption: Translucent, verrucous, and yellowish plaque, with central and pigmented nodule measuring 0.7 × 0.5 cm

title: Trichoblastoma Arising From the Nevus Sebaceus of Jadassohn.
label: Figure 2
caption: (a) Histological image of a nevus sebaceus. (b,c) Proliferation of primitive and abortive hair follicle structures, arranged in well-defined nests of basal cells with peripheral palisades surrounded by fibrous stroma, no retraction artifact. (d) Histological image with high magnification.
